biography.value: Releasing a phoenix from the Inner Planes creates an explosion of fire that spreads across the sky. An enormous fiery bird forms in the center of the flames and smoke—an elder Elemental possessed by a need to burn everything to ash. The phoenix rarely stays in one place for long as it strives to transform the world into an inferno.

source.book: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse
Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse

The phoenix makes one Beak attack and one Fiery Talons attack.

source.book: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse

description.value:
The phoenix can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature’s turn. The phoenix regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

Move. The phoenix moves up to its speed.

Peck. The phoenix makes one Beak attack.

Swoop (Costs 2 Actions). The phoenix moves up to its speed and makes one Fiery Talons attack.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

source.book: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse

source.book: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse

description.value:
Fiery Death and Rebirth. If the phoenix dies, it explodes. Each creature in 60-foot-radius &Reference[sphere]{sphere} centered on the phoenix must make a [[/save dex 20 format=long]], taking [[/damage 4d10 type=fire average=true]] damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The &Reference[fire]{fire} ignites flammable objects in the area that aren’t being worn or carried.

The explosion destroys the phoenix’s body and leaves behind an egg-shaped cinder, which weighs 5 pounds. The cinder deals [[/damage 6d6 type=fire average=true]] damage to any creature that touches it, though no more than once per round. The cinder is immune to all damage, and after 1d6 days, it hatches a new phoenix.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]] and a save is required.

source.book: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse

description.value:
&Reference[fire]{Fire} Form. The phoenix can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

Any creature that touches the phoenix or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes [[/damage 1d10 type=fire average=true]] damage. In addition, the phoenix can enter a hostile creature’s space and stop there. The first time it enters a creature’s space on a turn, that creature takes [[/damage 1d10 type=fire average=true]] damage.

With a touch, the phoenix can also ignite flammable objects that aren’t being worn or carried (no action required).

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

source.book: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse

description.value:
Flyby. The phoenix doesn’t provoke opportunity attack;opportunity attacks when it flies out of an enemy’s reach.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

source.book: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse

description.value:
Illumination. The phoenix sheds bright light in a 60-foot radius and dim light for an additional 60 feet.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

source.book: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse

description.value:
Legendary Resistance (3/Day). If the phoenix fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

source.book: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse

description.value:
Siege Monster. The phoenix deals double damage to objects and structures.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].
